isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 3.5: ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS, ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR/IVS SWITCH (APS/IVS) - BRAKE SWITCH CIRCUITS (BRAKE) - HYDRAULIC BRAKES

svcproc.title: HYDRAULIC BRAKES
svcproc.para:
Refer to the circuit diagram ( Figure 3.25
) for the following discussion.

With hydraulic brakes a double pole single throw switch is used. The switch is a self adjusting switch mounted at the brake pedal. When the brake is not applied the brake pedal holds the switch in the open state. Current is supplied by fuse F9 to the primary side of the switch and fuse F33 to the secondary side of the switch. Applying the brakes closes the switch to supply current to circuits 97M and 70C.

step1.para: Operate the turn signal switch relay for brake light operation.
Circuit 97N to signal the ECM at terminal 43 to indicate the brakes have been applied.

svcproc.para: Circuit 97M supplies voltage to the brake module and to the ECM at terminal 44 as a redundant signal to verify brake application.
